events.name: How To Apply Your Skills To Biotech - Automation
events.description: As AI & lab automation revolutionize scientific research-from robotic liquid handlers & automated cell imaging to AI-driven drug discovery & predictive modeling-they're also transforming how we train & grow the biotech workforce. Join Genspace & Dr. Kennedy McDaniel Bae for a seminar on the intersection of biotechnology, automation, & education. Whether you're a student, educator, researcher, or science enthusiast, this is a timely conversation about the evolving nature of scientific work & the future of inclusive, tech-forward training in the life sciences. About our speaker: Kennedy McDaniel Bae, Ph.D. (@BioOptimist) is a scientist shaping the future of laboratory automation to make research faster, more reproducible, & more accessible. With nearly a decade of experience innovating at the intersection of biology, hardware, & software she's helped solve real-world problems in neuro-computation, vaccine delivery, & materials development. She works with educators & innovators around the world to make sure the next generation of scientists can build with cutting-edge technology.

events.name: Open-Source NYC Computer Vision Hackathon w/ Moondream
events.description: New York never sleeps - & for 48 electrifying hours neither will you. Arm yourself with edge devices, camera modules, Moondream's lightning-fast 1 GB vision model, & whatever other hardware Jon can find on eBay (within budget). Tap directly into NYC's trove of open data - live traffic cams, 311 rodent alerts, taxi heat-maps, building blueprints - to transform every curb, crosswalk, & alleyway into a programmable canvas. We're wiring the city itself into your codebase. From flash-fire prototypes that untangle gridlock to edge-powered detectors that spotlight the city's next rat hotspot, this hackathon is your shot to prove how tiny models & civic data can make the five boroughs smarter overnight. No GPUs, no red tape, just pure hustle & open-source impact in the Big Apple  Theme - Edge Vision  NYC Open Data From curb-level transit analytics to automatic rodent recognition, teams must blend on-device inference, public datasets, & their imagination to create useful products for the urban landscape. Show how lightweight models + open data can make the city safer, cleaner, smarter, & even more New York

events.name: Cornell Tech @ Bloomberg w/ First Round Capital
events.description: **NOTE: This month's Cornell Tech @ Bloomberg event will be hosted at Bloomberg's 120 Park Avenue office. Please check the WHEN & WHERE section below for details.** Bloomberg, Cornell Tech, & Tech:NYC invite you to join us for the latest installment of the Cornell Tech @ Bloomberg Speaker Series, featuring Hayley Barna, Partner at First Round Capital, in conversation with Caroline Hyde, host of Bloomberg Television's flagship daily technology show. First Round Capital is an early-stage venture firm that has backed transformative companies such as Uber, Square, Notion, & Warby Parker. As the co-founder & former co-CEO of beauty subscription startup Birchbox, Hayley scaled the company into a category-defining brand that reshaped how consumers discover & buy beauty products, leading the company through growth, scale, & global expansion. Since joining First Round Capital in 2016, Hayley has focused on bringing a founder-operator empathy to her work with early-stage entrepreneurs. Her investments span sectors from consumer products & digital health to enterprise SaaS, including game-changing companies like Mirror, Alma, Thirty Madison, & Arbor. Hayley also knows firsthand what it takes to build & scale enduring companies in today's market, & how early-stage capital can catalyze outsized impact.We hope you'll register to attend this exciting conversation, where Barna will share her journey from startup founder to venture capitalist, offer her take on the next wave of breakout startups, & explore what it means to back bold ideas from day one.

events.description: Join us for our NJ FAST Expo. More details to come! Startups Pitches Listed Below: Squirro turns meaningless data into A.I.-driven actionable Insights. Venteur is an AI-powered benefits marketplace that empowers individuals to take control of their health care. DeepKeep multimodal AI security safeguards machine learning pipelines, promoting secure, unbiased, real time & trustworthy AI solutions. Penelope is a self-service retirement platform for small & micro businesses. Vaultik is the bank for your belongings that unlocks a new world of post sale opportunities including perks, insurance, & credit services for high net worth individuals. Markets EQ provides GenAI solution providing competitive tonal analysis, previously unavailable awareness. Cranium is an AI security & trust platform that delivers security & trust to the AI revolution. Ledge is a command center for payments built for finance teams operating at scale. Column is an AI-powered insurance management platform designed for today's financial professionals. Clarista is a data analytics platform that provides real-time answers from any enterprise platform, acting as a bridge between technical data & AI. OpenVC provides investible unicorn indexes of the most innovative late-stage venture capital companies.  AQ22 is a loan assessment AI solution built exclusively for credit analysts. events.name: New Rules Of Branding, Advertising & Mktg - Trust, Tech & Transformation
events.description: La French Tech New York invites you to an exclusive fireside chat on June 17, 2025, featuring visionary leaders from iconic & forward-thinking brands who are shaping the future of marketing, advertising, communications, & consumer trust in the era of AI & emerging technologies. This thought-provoking conversation will explore how innovation is redefining key pillars of brand strategy-from strengthening brand safety & countering misinformation to enabling data-driven insights, verifying content authenticity, & delivering deeply personalized, immersive experiences. It's a unique opportunity to gain perspective on how technology is not only transforming engagement but also fostering loyalty in an increasingly digital world. Co-hosted by La French Tech NYC, Business France, & the French-American Chamber of Commerce New York (FACC-NY), the evening brings together transatlantic voices at the forefront of digital transformation. The event will include a 45-minute fireside chat followed by a cocktail reception-offering both inspiration & connection as we explore how legacy institutions & next-gen innovators alike are navigating this rapidly evolving landscape. Panelists include: Anne-Isabelle Choueiri - SVP, Transformation & Strategic Initiatives, Este Lauder Companies Renato Meier - Director of Marketing & Communications, Breitling North America Grgoire Assemat Tessandier - President Publicis Digital Experience, Publicis Juliette Arnaud - Senior Director of Commerce Systems, Herms Moderator: Kimiya Shams - Board Member, La French Tech NYC Agenda: Doors Open: 6:00 PM Panel Begins: 6:45 PM Networking Cocktail Reception to Follow Explore how technology is not just transforming marketing & advertising-it's redefining what it means to be a trusted brand in a digital world.

events.name: UN Tech Over Hackathon - Ahead Of The Storm
events.description: UN Tech Over Hackathon The UN Tech Over is a series of hackathons & tech-related challenges that aim to celebrate the great potential of technology & its pivotal role in advancing progress on the UN Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). The event fosters collaboration, awareness, & engagement with the open source community, demonstrating the transformative power of technology & multi-stakeholder cooperation in solving real-world problems. *Please note that the UN Tech Over events will only be taking place in person. Express your interest in participating in one of our three UN Tech Over Events below!Resigster here: https://forms.office.com/e/gSuBsez6dd   Event : Edit-A-Thon Date: 16 June (10:00 - 18:00) Location: ECOSOC Chamber The Edit-A-Thon aims to leverage the research & critical thinking capacities of participants worldwide, fostering collaboration to update Wikipedia pages & descriptions on relevant themes & key moments in the history of the United Nations. This event celebrates the 70th anniversary of the admission of the Italian Republic & of Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka to the United Nations. The event will host participants interested in employing their research, analytical, & communication skills, as well as participants interested in education & in the creation & subsequent evolution of the United Nations as an organization. Throughout the day, experts & mentors will assist participants in updating these pages so as to publish in-depth, accurate reports. Attendees will need to have a Wikipedia account to edit pages. Please create your account prior to the event. Wikipedia usernames are public, so you do not have to use your real name; it is recommended to use a pseudonym or nickname as your username. Stay tuned for additional information about the Edit-A-Thon event during UN Tech Over.   Event : Maintain-A-Thon Date: 16 June (10:00 - 18:00) Location: ECOSOC Chamber The Maintain-A-Thon invites participants to explore the vital but often invisible work of maintaining critical open source infrastructure. As part of the 2025 UN Open Source Week & UN Tech Over event, this Maintain-A-Thon convenes key maintainers from all over the world & highlights the importance of sustainability & long-term stewardship in open source digital infrastructure. Experienced open source maintainers & interested participants will take part in hands-on activities that tackle the working realities of open source maintenance, from practices of issue triage, documentation, & software upkeep. For aspiring maintainers & current contributors alike, this is an opportunity to learn from each other on the challenges & rewards of maintaining open source projects. Senior maintainers will offer mentorship for anyone interested in contributing to the critical & open components that form the foundations of our digital lives & power the projects achieving the UN's Sustainable Development Goals. Stay tuned for additional information about the Maintain-A-Thon event during UN Tech Over.    Interested in participating? Register for the UN Tech Over Hackathon here today: https://forms.office.com/e/gSuBsez6dd  For more information, visit the UN Tech Over Hackathon website here: https://www.un.org/digital-emerging-technologies/content/open-source-week-2025

events.name: MetaProp Accelerator Demo Day
events.description: Join us in NYC for MetaProp's 2025 Demo Day on June 17th. Be among the first to meet the next generation of PropTech innovators as the six startups in MetaProp's latest Accelerator cohort take the stage. This exclusive event brings together top investors, industry leaders, & select media to hear firsthand from visionary founders tackling the real estate industry's most pressing challenges. June 17, 20259:00 AM - 12:00 PM ESTMidtown Manhattan (RSVP for address) If you have any questions, please get in touch with Evan Petitt at epetitt@metaprop.com. This marquee event has limited space & fills up fast every year. 2025 Cohort BUILDRFI (Miami) - BuildrFi streamlines financial workflows for construction by offering a clear view of project cash flows & financing options, helping to manage material costs & delayed payments. FRAM ENERGY (NYC) - Fram Energy makes solar deployment for multifamily & single-family rentals profitable & effortless through tenant energy billing software. POPWHEELS (NYC) - PopWheels is revolutionizing urban mobility in America with its e-bike battery swap network, starting with the 80,000+ delivery workers in NYC. PROPRISE (SF) - PropRise is an AI-driven commercial real estate deal sourcing platform, transforming how firms discover & evaluate opportunities. ULAMA (NYC) - Ulama is AI-powered code compliance that automates the approval of construction permit applications. WEALTHIE (NYC) - Wealthie builds more wealth for homeowners by investing home equity in diversified assets without loans or debt.

events.name: Creative Mornings
events.description: Welcome Liza Donnelly to The Morgan Library & Museum Stage! Liza Donnelly is a writer & cartoonist for The New Yorker Magazine, where she has been drawing cartoons & writing about culture & politics for forty years. She has been a contributor to CBS News & CNN, creating political cartoons & animation, as well as live-drawing special cultural & political events. Donnelly writes & draws for The New York Times & CNN Opinion pages, The Washington Post, Medium. She publishes a daily newsletter of writing & drawings called Seeing Things on Substack. Donnelly's TED talk was translated into 42 languages & viewed over 1.5 million times. Donnelly was the first cartoonist to be granted access on location to live draw the Academy Awards. Both on location & remotely, she covered the DNC, Inauguration, presidential debates, State of The Union, Trump trials, election returns, the Emmys, the Golden Globes, the Grammys, the BET Awards, the Tonys. Donnelly is the author/editor of eighteen books for adults & children, most notably Very Funny Ladies, a history of women cartoonists of The New Yorker. Donnelly is currently producing & directing a documentary called Women Laughing, based on her book Very Funny Ladies, to premier in 2025. Performance by Gabbie McGee With two independent albums (Certified Soul, Mississippis Daughter) under her belt, BMI Independent Songwriters Recognition for her song Mississippis Daughter, The 2014 Belk Modern Southern Music Award, the 2014 Mississippi Arts Council Artist of the Year Award, & featured appearances in the 2015 Emmy Award-winning HBO feature film Bessie & the 2016 Academy Award-nominated Hidden Figures, Gabbie McGee is rapidly becoming a recognizable face & name in the entertainment industry. Known for her powerful vocals & heart-gripping lyrics, Gabbie has also made her mark behind the scenes as a music composer, contributing original music to Season 6 of TV ONEs Rickey Smiley For Real & writing, producing, & performing the theme song Turn on the Lights for the 2020 remake of Avenging Angels, directed by Ilunga Adell. In 2025, Gabbie is piloting her latest venture, Jazz Lives in the Library, an innovative cultural preservation & education initiative designed to celebrate the legacy of jazz through live performance, literacy, & community engagement.

events.name: Bitcoin & Brews - Permissionless IV
events.description: Rootstock's legendary Bitcoin & Brews is coming toNew York during Permissionless IV. Join us at Pubkey, NY's favourite Bitcoin bar for an evening of drinks & discussions.nnWhether youre a lightning network super user, exploring BTC DeFi, building dApps secured by Bitcoin, running a node, or holding Bitcoin as part of your treasury, its a great chance to connect with developers, leaders & the broader Bitcoin community.n Panel Discussion: Advancing Bitcoins FuturenHear from a panel of industry experts on how they see Bitcoin evolving in the next five years & beyond.nThe speaker lineup so far features:nPete Rizzo (@pete_rizzo_) Bitcoin Historian & JournalistnDiego Gutierrez Zaldivar (@dieguito) Latin American internet pioneer. Co-founder of Rootstock, LABITCONF & KoibanxnHunter Beast (@cryptoquick) Bitcoin Developer & Author of BIP360 to bring quantum resistance to BitcoinnRed Sheehan (@redvelvet) co-founder LemonDrop & Bitcoin LayersnPLUS SPECIAL GUESTS ANNOUNCED SOONnJoin the NY Bitcoin community from 6pm 'til late to paint the town orange.nnAbout PubkeynPubKey is a dive bar & public meeting house where casual conversations & revolutionary ideas mix freely.  Located in New York's historic West Village, PubKey is where Bitcoiners & No Coiners can gather for a good time & share big ideas.nnAbout RootstocknRootstock is Bitcoin's DeFi Layer. It combines the programmability of Ethereum with the store of value & decentralisation of Bitcoin.nRootstock is used by people & organisation around the world to access financial services secured by the Bitcoin network including BTC collaterised stablecoins, lending & staking protocols & more. Hundreds of decentralised applications are built on & integrated with Rootstock today.nLaunched in 2018, Rootstock is secured by over 80% of Bitcoins hash power through a consensus mechanism known as merge-mined proof-of-work.  Rootstock uses the Solidity programming language & is fully EVM-compatible. This means anything you can build on any other EVM chain can also be deployed on Bitcoin using Rootstockwithout any additional tools.

With over 15 years of experience in UX & interaction design, he focuses on creating intuitive, accessible, & scalable solutions that enhance customer engagement & drive business outcomes. Join us for an engaging panel discussion featuring top design minds in fintech as they explore how innovative design thinking is transforming complex financial products into seamless, trusted experiences. events.name: Coolest Figma-Less AI Design Workflow & Fundraiser Party
events.description: This is the most impressive AI design demo I've seen yet.Hang out with 200+ senior designers at Ramp's beautiful Flatiron office where founding designer Steve Witmer will demo a new AI-first Figma-less design process. It's made him 2x faster without sacrificing craft or quality, & just might break your brain a little, in a good way. Catering & refreshments will be provided courtesy of Ramp.   Ping pong party hosted by Mobbin & Optimal Afterwards, we head to Spin for an after party with: Complimentary cocktails & finger foods Ping pong tournament matches Raffles with big prizes Shuffleboard, corn hole, oversized Connect-4 & Jenga Plenty of space to mingle for folks just wanting to chill & chat   Who is this for? Senior designers who want to see a cutting edge AI design workflow capable of replacing Figma completely. Design, product & engineering execs rethinking how teams design with AI. Builders who want to skip the theory & see the tools in action. Note: Because our event content is intended to level up senior designers, participants must be in a senior design or design-adjacent role, OR have a minimum of 5 yrs of experience in the UX or Product design field.  Schedule 6PM-7PM - Doors open at Ramp, mingling time with other senior designers, grab dinner & drinks courtesy of Ramp. 7PM-8PM - Demo with designer Steve Witmer showcasing an AI-first design process followed by Q&A 8PM-9PM - Continue mingling with other designers 9PM-12AM - Party at Spin (5 min away) for a ping pong tournament, cocktails & snacks. Activities include ping pong, cornhole, Connect-4, Jenga, & shuffleboard. 12AM - End of party, please get home safe!

events.name: Techspo New York 2025 Technology Expo
events.description: About TECHSPO New York 2025Where Business, Tech & Innovation Collide in NYC! TECHSPO New York 2025 is your chance to  - Check out exhibitors showcasing the next generation of technology & innovation. - Be inspired, amazed & educated on how these evolving technologies will impact your business for greater growth. - Interact with technology enthusiasts, build your network & reunite with your peers. The 11th annual TECHSPO New York, two-day technology expo returns July 7th & 8th, 2025 to the luxurious New York Marriott at the Brooklyn Bridge Hotel in New York City, NY. TECHSPO New York brings together some of the best developers, brands, marketers, technology providers, designers, innovators & evangelists looking to set the pace in our advanced world of technology. Watch exhibitors showcase the next generation of advances in technology & innovation, including; Internet, Mobile, AdTech, MarTech & SaaS technologies. Be prepared to be inspired, amazed & educated on how these evolving technologies will impact your business for greater growth. As part of TECHSPO New York is a limited attendance paid event, DigiMarCon East 2025 Digital Marketing, Media & Advertising Conference (https://digimarconeast.com). If the conference is where the learning, theory & inspiration happens, then the TECHSPO floor is where the testing, networking & product interaction takes place. For complete details visit https://techsponyc.com.  Event ZonesHere's a peek at what you will see at TECHSPO: Auditorium - The Auditorium is a live stage with round-table seating of speaker presentations. Presentations feature Keynotes. Industry Panels & Master Classes given by Expert Speakers in the digital marketing industry, providing attendees with digital marketing best practices, latest trends, practical solutions & strategy.Exhibition Hall - The Exhibition Hall showcases the next generation of technology & innovation; Internet, Mobile, AdTech, MarTech & SaaS. The Exhibition Hall includes ample break tables for networking with your peers.Training Theater - The Training Theater has a mix of a selection of live streamed sessions from DigiMarCon Digital Marketing, Media & Advertising Conference throughout the event program & a Lunch & Learn presentation during the Networking Luncheon.Podcast Studio - The Podcast Studio is an interactive space where visitors are able to sit in & view live intermittent interviews between a host & selected exhibitors, speakers and.Dining Hall - The Dining Hall is where food & beverage catering is provided. Use these scheduled networking breaks to get to know the people you connect with via social networks-up close & personal.Photo Booth - Get your photo taken at the Photo Booth & real-time share on your Social Media Channels. The Photo Booth is a fun interactive experience in the Exhibition Hall that makes your visit more memorable. PassesCheck out your pass options below. For the best onsite experience a 1-Day Training Pass, 2-Day All Access Pass or 2-Day VIP Pass is recommended. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Visitor Pass is a 1-day limited pass that includes: TECHSPO Hall (Access between 9:00am - TECHSPO New York brings together some of the best developers, brands, marketers, technology providers, designers, innovators & evangelists looking to set the pace in our advanced world of technology. Watch exhibitors showcase the next generation of advances in technology & innovation, including; Internet, Mobile, AdTech, MarTech & SaaS technologies. Be prepared to be inspired, amazed & educated on how these evolving technologies will impact your business for greater growth. As part of TECHSPO New York is a limited attendance paid event, DigiMarCon East 2025 Digital Marketing, Media & Advertising Conference (https://digimarconeast.com). If the conference is where the learning, theory & inspiration happens, then the TECHSPO floor is where the testing, networking & product interaction takes place. For complete details visit https://techsponyc.com.  Event ZonesHere's a peek at what you will see at TECHSPO: Auditorium - The Auditorium is a live stage with round-table seating of speaker presentations. Presentations feature Keynotes. Industry Panels & Master Classes given by Expert Speakers in the digital marketing industry, providing attendees with digital marketing best practices, latest trends, practical solutions & strategy.Exhibition Hall - The Exhibition Hall showcases the next generation of technology & innovation; Internet, Mobile, AdTech, MarTech & SaaS. The Exhibition Hall includes ample break tables for networking with your peers.Training Theater - The Training Theater has a mix of a selection of live streamed sessions from DigiMarCon Digital Marketing, Media & Advertising Conference throughout the event program & a Lunch & Learn presentation during the Networking Luncheon.Podcast Studio - The Podcast Studio is an interactive space where visitors are able to sit in & view live intermittent interviews between a host & selected exhibitors, speakers and.Dining Hall - The Dining Hall is where food & beverage catering is provided. Use these scheduled networking breaks to get to know the people you connect with via social networks-up close & personal.Photo Booth - Get your photo taken at the Photo Booth & real-time share on your Social Media Channels. events.name: AI In Space - Exploring Future Of Data, Discovery & Design
events.description: A Space Apps NYC 2025 Preview Event Join us for a dynamic, multi-speaker session previewing Space Apps NYC 2025-where curiosity meets code & cosmic questions become collaborative experiments. This event brings together NASA datasets, AI-powered workflows, & mind-expanding applications of space science. Hear from: Cloudflare on how AI is reshaping coding workflows & developer productivity Steven Jaret (AMNH) on decoding the story of our solar system through meteorite research Michael Caprio (Tesla Science Center) on Open Space, a 3D platform visualizing real NASA mission data And more voices exploring how open data & public science can fuel both education & innovation Whether you're a student, scientist, coder, or community builder-this is your launchpad to get involved, get inspired, & get ready for this year's Space Apps challenge. In an age of AI & institutional uncertainty, the next generation of civic & tech leaders needs more than just skills-they need to practice working across silos, building with clarity, & designing for meaning. That's what Space Apps + SWARM is. Not just a hackathon. A year-long civic sandbox for: students to grow orgs to connect problems to get visible systems to be made legible and life to improve on Earth & in space Pizza & light refreshments will be served. Community Partners:

events.name: Petrov Day
events.description: "Wherever you are, whatever you're doing, take a minute to not destroy the world." https://www.lesswrong.com/posts/QtyKq4BDyuJ3tysoK/9-26-is-petrov-day https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Man_Who_Saved_the_World Ways to celebrate: * Screening of the film "The Man Who Saved The World"? (It's pretty good!) * X-risk discussion meetup? * Call your representatives to express your views on any upcoming nuclear risk-related bills?

events.name: World Longevity Day
events.description:
These nice people keep track of Longevity Day celebrations around the world:

http://www.longevityhistory.com/longevity-day-and-longevity-month/

...but while people are living longer every year, there haven't been more Longevity Day celebrations every year. If that seems "off" to you, why not host one yourself? And then tell the folks at LongevityHistory.com!

The website has records of past events, which may offer ideas for how to celebrate. If you have any cool ideas of your own, let us know: alexrk@effectivealtruism.nyc

events.name: World Vegetarian Day
events.description:
"To promote the joy, compassion and life-enhancing possibilities of vegetarianism."


https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Vegetarian_Day


Also the beginning of Vegetarian Awareness Month -- though it's never a bad time to be aware of the vegetarians around you!

events.name: World Vegan Day
events.description:
The perfect day to eat all of your Halloween candy! (No milk chocolate, though.)

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Vegan_Day

events.name: Happy birthday, Giving What We Can!
events.description: Giving What We Can was officially founded on November 14th, 2009. Every anniversary represents a few hundred more people (and in the future, perhaps even larger numbers) who have committed a substantial fraction of their income to helping others effectively. Huzzah!

events.name: Smallpox Eradication Day
events.description:
http://effective-altruism.com/ea/1t5/500_million_but_not_a_single_one_more/


500 million people died, but we turned "Smallpox is" into "Smallpox was". This is one of our species' greatest victories over suffering; it's a good time to celebrate and to remember.
.

events.name: Derek Parfit's Birthday!
events.description:
Derek Parfit was perhaps the greatest moral philosopher of the 20th century, in how he shaped the discipline and raised important new questions. 

He gave us the Repugnant Conclusion and the Hitchhiker's Dilemma, and put a plug for giving 10% into On What Matters, his masterpiece. Had he lived long enough to finish another volume, he had plans to discuss existential risk and dive deeper into questions of how we ought to act.

How to celebrate Parfit's life and work? You could discuss population ethics, philosophize about something else, or consider, as a group, ways to make your lives slightly more rational. (Or just eat cake and sing Happy Birthday and engage in idle, friendly conversation; Parfit surely wouldn't object.)

events.name: John Snow's Birthday!
events.description:
No, not the George R. R. Martin one. The one who helped found epidemiology!

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Snow


Celebrate today by drinking clean water!

events.name: Norman Borlaug's Birthday!
events.description:
How can you celebrate an agronomist who fed billions?

...we're not sure yet, but maybe you can make something tasty with GMO wheat flour?

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Norman_Borlaug

events.name: World Health Day
events.description:
Some say that April is the cruelest month. The WHO begs to differ:

http://www.who.int/campaigns/world-health-day/2018/en/

Speaking of April, keep an eye out for World Malaria Day and World Immunization Week later this month.

events.name: World Immunization Week
events.description:
No matter what year you read this, it's probably the healthiest year in human history. Let's celebrate, and keep the streak going!
http://www.who.int/campaigns/immunization-week/2018/en/

events.name: World Malaria Day
events.description:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Malaria_Day

If you have ideas for ways to commemorate this day, send them to alexrk@effectivealtruism.nyc

events.name: Intro to Soldering Workshop: Make an LED Tile
events.description:
RSVP https://www.eventbrite.com/e/intro-to-soldering-workshop-make-an-led-tile-tickets-1369929639429

Soldering is one of the most important skills you'll need for working with electronics. Come join us for an introductory through-hole solderSoldering is one of the most important skills you'll need for working with electronics. Come join us for an introductory through-hole soldering workshop. Soldering enables you to create sturdy connections between electrical components. In this hands-on workshop, you'll learn how to use a soldering iron safely and effectively, and get plenty of practice with both soldering and de-soldering techniques. We'll be soldering up some Game of Life kits - LED tiles that generate nifty animations. No previous experience is required, making this introductory workshop a great choice for anyone who's curious about getting started with hardware tinkering! All materials will be provided.
OK, awesome, I want to join!
Please be ready to start at 1pm! We find that you will need this time to get through the whole class. Our classes tend to sell out about a week in advance so if you're interested, you may want to sign up early.
This class will be taught by Resistor member Raphael.
As with all NYC Resistor events, this class is 18+ and governed by our Code of Conduct. The Code of Conduct, as well as accessibility information, can be found at www.nycresistor.com/participate/. Please note that refunds must be requested 72 hours in advance. If you have any questions, please email classes@nycresistor.com.

Vaccination Proof + Mask + RSVP Required
RSVP https://www.eventbrite.com/e/nycresistor-ham-radio-club-tickets-1113096554759

Monthly Amateur Radio club meeting of NYCResistorRadio curious? Join the NYC Resistor Ham Radio Club (call sign N2YCR) for our open and regular meetings, the 4th Wednesday of each month from 8:00 – 9:30 pm at NYC Resistor (87 3rd Avenue, 4th Floor).
The amateur radio hobby has something for everyone, from Morse code to modern digital modes. events.name: Synthesizer Night @ NYC Resistor
events.description:
RSVP https://www.eventbrite.com/e/synthesizer-night-nyc-resistor-tickets-1374984639069

Gathering musicians, enthusiasts, and curious minds to connect, collaborate, and share their passion for synthesis. BYO synth encouraged!Join us at NYC Resistor, a makerspace in Brooklyn for an electrifying Synthesizer Night! Get ready to unleash your creativity, explore sonic landscapes, and connect with fellow synth enthusiasts in an evening dedicated to the mesmerizing world of synthesizers. This is a pay-what-you-wish event (recommended donation $8).
Synthesizer Night at NYC Resistor is a celebration of all things synthesizer. Whether you're a seasoned musician, an avid collector, or simply fascinated by the possibilities of electronic sound, this event offers a unique opportunity to gather with like-minded individuals and revel in the captivating soundscape of synthesizers.
At Synthesizer Night, participants are encouraged to bring their own synthesizers, from vintage analog gems to cutting-edge modular wonders. It's a chance to showcase your personal setup, experiment with new equipment, and dive into the rich sonic tapestry that synthesizers offer.
For those looking to enhance the collaborative experience, consider arriving early to connect your synthesizer to a MIDI/CV clock. This allows for synchronized timing among all instruments, creating a seamless musical fusion during impromptu jam sessions.
In addition to the collaborative jam sessions, the event provides a unique opportunity for a show and tell/play with anything that attendees bring. Share your favorite gear, experiment with different setups, and engage in hands-on exploration of various synthesizers and electronic music equipment.
The event unfolds in a relaxed and welcoming atmosphere, providing a platform for musicians, enthusiasts, and curious minds to connect, collaborate, and share their passion for synthesis. Whether you're a beginner seeking guidance or an expert eager to inspire others, Synthesizer Night is the perfect setting to engage in conversations, exchange knowledge, and foster a vibrant community. 
Throughout the evening, you'll have the opportunity to engage in impromptu jam sessions, where the collective energy of multiple synthesizers intertwines to create awe-inspiring sounds. Experience the joy of collaborating with fellow musicians, experiment with different genres and styles, and let the unique characteristics of each instrument shape your sonic explorations.
Additionally, for those who wish to showcase their skills and perform, there will be dedicated performance slots. Take center stage, captivate the audience, and let your creativity soar as you demonstrate the full potential of your synthesizer setup. To sign up for a performance slot, email classes@nycresistor.com or join our Discord and post to #synth.
Whether you're an ardent synth enthusiast, an aspiring musician, or simply curious about the captivating world of synthesizers, Synthesizer Night at NYC Resistor is an event that will inspire, educate, and leave you in awe of the boundless possibilities that electronic sound offers. Don't miss this opportunity to immerse yourself in an evening of music, collaboration, and innovation. Mark your calendars, pack up your favorite synths, and join us at NYC Resistor for a night you won't soon forget. We can't wait to see you there!
This is a masks optional event.
As with all NYC Resistor events, this class is 18+ and governed by our Code of Conduct. The Code of Conduct, as well as accessibility information, can be found at www.nycresistor.com/participate/.

events.name: diyaudio.nyc JuneMeetup
events.description:
RSVP https://www.eventbrite.com/e/diyaudionyc-junemeetup-tickets-1408840352419

Resistor hosts a meetup for the diyaudio.nyc group, and invites anyone to come learn about making your own home audio gear.diyaudio.nyc has regular meetups to share recent DIY projects (speakers, amps, preamps, tubes and solid state - anything home-audio related), as well as talks and demos on related topics and skills (how to solder, how digital crossovers work, fabrication techniques, digital room correction, etc). Building your own gear doesn't have to be a solitary hobby anymore... has regular meetups to share recent DIY audio projects (speakers, amps, DACs, etc - anything home-audio related), as well as talks and demos on related topics and skills (how to solder, how digital crossovers work, fabrication techniques, digital room correction, etc).
This month we're going to show off some new and exciting speaker and amp projects, a demo on how to refurbish a classic iPod(!), and we'll also have a tutorial on how to simulate bass-reflex enclosures in WinISD - a key skill for anyone looking to design their own speakers.It always sounds better when you build it yourself.
Have a project you'd like to share? Let us know at diyaudio@gowanusaudio.com and we'll add it to the list.
(If history is any guide, at the end of the meetup some of us will want to keep talking about projects and we'll move to a bar nearby - join us!)
Who should come?
Open to anyone interested in DIY home audio who wants to learn and make some new friends - all experience levels welcome. If you've ever wanted to build any audio gear, we're here for you. (We generally don't focus on production, live sound, musical instruments, or making music, although there certainly is some overlap.)
Note from the organizer, Pete:
I started diyaudio.nyc a couple years ago because I wanted to meet some like-minded folks near me - I knew they were out there. And they are! Thank you for being a part! Let's grow this group! These days, for me, it's all audio all the time - I work as a Buyer for The Music Room buying high end audio equipment, and also offer complete classes to build your own equipment as Gowanus Audio.
This is a masks optional event.
As with all NYC Resistor events, this class is 18+ and governed by our Code of Conduct. The Code of Conduct, as well as accessibility information, can be found at www.nycresistor.com/participate/. If you have any questions, please email classes@nycresistor.com

events.name: Eco-Resin Fabric Casting Class
events.description:
RSVP https://www.eventbrite.com/e/eco-resin-fabric-casting-class-tickets-1407554997889

Make various accessories by upcycling fabric scraps and using them as the decorative colorant within eco-resin! All materials provided.Lizzy Gee, a sustainable fashion designer, leads a lesson in how to make various accessories by upcycling fabric scraps and using them as the decorative colorant within eco-resin! They’ve been experimenting and honing this innovative craft, that uses a material that is NOT plastic to mold into any shape you can imagine. They use the genius method of embedding the smallest scraps from their collections, so that nothing goes to waste.This workshop is perfect for those who want learn to do resin-pours, textile artists who want to make brilliant use of your smallest scraps, and anyone who wants to spend a few hours making your own beautiful jewelry, beads, pendants, keychains, or experiment with a new sustainable method! Choose between a pair of earrings, necklace, buttons and/or keychain!All materials are supplied! Eco-Resin, molds, and a dehydrator for a faster drying process! Bring your own beloved too-good-to-toss scraps, or use Lizzy Gee’s gorgeous textile tidbits! Also, while we wait for your creations to dry, feel free to bring your own mending/sewing/textile projects and get advice from a seasoned sustainable designer about next steps. Lizzy is open to all levels of maker and hopes to see you there!
No experience required! You just need to be interested in sustainability and/or textiles. Everyone is welcome.Your Instructor:
Lizzy has always found it natural to express her ideas with a visual language. Lizzy saw the design process as a self-empowering tool to make her ideas transcend to reality and foster a genuine inclusivity.  By age 11, she was creating entire collections from inspiration to runway.  A native of Philadelphia, Lizzy moved to Brooklyn, New York to pursue her dream of creating a sustainable, inclusive fashion brand.  She attended Pratt Institute after earning a scholarship in their Fashion Design program.  After graduating with honors in 2018, she continued to develop her brand and has showcased her collections in Fashion Weeks in New York, London, and Philadelphia.  Not only did she launch her business within the first of year of graduating, but also founded a sustainable New York Fashion Week initiative called IMPACT NYFW.  Practicing sustainable design with her brand, she wanted to further transcend eco-conscious methods in regards to how designs were presented by acting on another passion- event production. IMPACT is an annual, alternative New York fashion week platform for emerging, sustainable designers to showcase their work while making an impact beyond the runway by donating ticket proceeds to an environmental non-profit. Along with IMPACT, her award-winning designs have been showcased in galleries at Moore College of Art and Design, University of the Arts Philadelphia, Pratt Institute, and Screaming Mimi's NYC front window display.  While studying fashion at Pratt, Lizzy apprenticed for many successful designers, including Christian Siriano, Badgley Mischka, Mara Hoffman, and Nicola Formichetti. Not only have her colorful designs been worn by music artists, such as, Grimes and Kimbra, but they’ve also been highlighted in publications including British Vogue and Schon! magazine. Lizzy is continuing to build her sustainable brand with the mission of giving the world innovative perspectives of beauty and functional design by breaking the boundaries of social constructs limiting our potential as individuals.This is a masks optional workshop.
As with all NYC Resistor events, this class is 18+ and governed by our Code of Conduct. The Code of Conduct, as well as accessibility information, can be found at www.nycresistor.com/participate/.

NYC Resistor is open to the public for Craft Nights now every Monday and Thursday from 6:30-9:30 PM! Come bring your current crafting project and work on it with other artists, crafters, and makers of all kinds. Resistors do everything from costumes to electronics to visual arts to woodworking; people and crafting projects of all sorts are enthusiastically welcome!

RSVP at https://www.eventbrite.com/e/public-craft-night-mondays-and-thursdays-tickets-162729866411 is appreciated but not required, for covid contact-tracing purposes.

This event like all NYC Resistor events is 18 and over and governed by out code of conduct.

More information: http://www.nycresistor.com/participate/
NYC Resistor Code of Conduct: http://www.nycresistor.com/2015/08/04/nyc-resistor-code-of-conduct/

events.name: NYCResistor Ham Radio Club
events.description:
Vaccination Proof + Mask + RSVP Required
RSVP https://www.eventbrite.com/e/nycresistor-ham-radio-club-tickets-1113096574819

Monthly Amateur Radio club meeting of NYCResistorRadio curious? Join the NYC Resistor Ham Radio Club (call sign N2YCR) for our open and regular meetings, the 4th Wednesday of each month from 8:00 – 9:30 pm at NYC Resistor (87 3rd Avenue, 4th Floor).
The amateur radio hobby has something for everyone, from Morse code to modern digital modes. Bring projects you're working on, gear to fix, problems that puzzle you, outings you'd like to organize, or just yourself to meet & greet your friendly local hams. Drop by the #n2ycr channel in Discord any time to say hi.
You do not need to be a member of Resistor to be a member of the club, nor do you need to be a licensed amateur radio operator (though of course we hope you'll become licensed with our help).
We aim to create an inclusive, encouraging, and diverse environment to bring together Brooklyn's radio hackers, antenna experimenters, shortwave listeners, toroid winders, satellite chasers, and balloon launchers.
Come make some noise in the weird and wonderful medium of radio!This is a masks optional event.
As with all NYC Resistor events, this class is 18+ and governed by our Code of Conduct. The Code of Conduct, as well as accessibility information, can be found at www.nycresistor.com/participate/.
Please note that refunds must be requested 24 hours in advance. If you have any questions, please email classes@nycresistor.com.

events.name: Maximum New York June Party & Abundance Politics Accelerator
events.description: ​Come hang out with friends, hear some lightning talks about NYC city/state politics, find collaborators for your own political schemes, and have a good time!​You'll enjoy the company of MNY alumni, people from theabundance movementgenerally, and other guests.​There will be drinks and snacks!​The formal business agenda will be posted soon. It will include:​Presentations of no more than ~10 minutes​Details on the Abundance Resolution that attendees may vote on.​Updates on city and state politics!​Know before you arrive:This event will be guided by thefour rules of etiquettethat guide all Maximum New York classes, and is generally for people who mostly agree withThe Sensible Seventy.

events.name: Olive Tree Writing Retreat
events.description: ​We’re hosting our first-ever writing retreat!​Whether you’re working on a novel, a poetry collection, a longform Substack post, or just starting out, this retreat is for anyone looking to dive deep into their writing alongside others on the same journey.​What to expect?​⏰Focused Writing BlocksPlenty of uninterrupted time to go heads down and make real progress on your projects.​🛋Social TimeWe’ll have downtime to rest, play, and connect.​📣Share & CelebrateWrap up the weekend with an intimate open mic-style session. Share a chapter, a poem, or even just a sentence, whatever you want to celebrate, we’ll cheer you on.​How much does it cost?​Tickets will be$500and will include:​✔️ Roundtrip transportation from NYC​✔️ Two nights in a beautiful upstate home​✔️ All meals, snacks, and drinks included​Spots are limitedso we can keep the experience intimate and intentional.​Let’s make it the most productive and inspiring writing weekend of your life.

events.name: 110th NY Hardware Meetup @ Industry City/Adafruit | Space Tech
events.description: ​​​​The Hardware Meetup community is excited to announce the next NY Hardware Meetup inIndustry CityatAdafruit! This month's event will be about the growing NYC space tech industry.​​​​​Hardware Meetupshappen in over 30 cities around the world, bringing together hardware professionals to network and learn from each other.​​​​​This month we'll behosted byAdafruitat their facility inIndustry City!​Adafruit, established in 2005 by MIT engineer Limor Fried, has been at the forefront of the maker movement. It provides an unparalleled online platform for electronics education, the Internet of Things (IoT), and the latest high-tech chips for engineering. With a commitment to excellence and open-source, Adafruit is a trusted resource for makers and engineers of all ages and skill levels. Adafruit has expanded its offerings to include tools, equipment, and electronics that Fried personally selects, tests, and approves before they go into the Adafruit store. Adafruit is a 100% woman-owned manufacturing company, a certified Minority and Woman-owned Business Enterprise (M/WBE), a certified Women’s Business Enterprise (WBE), and WOSB.​Industry City is a dynamic 35-acre creative campus on the Brooklyn waterfront in Sunset Park. Once a historic industrial hub, it has been transformed into a vibrant destination blending innovation, culture, and community. Home to over 650 businesses across 16 buildings, Industry City offers a unique mix of artisanal shops, global eateries, art installations, and event spaces. Whether you're here for a meetup, to explore the diverse food options, or to enjoy live events, Industry City provides an inspiring backdrop for connection and creativity.​​​SPEAKERS​Limor Fried. Adafruit was founded in 2005 by MIT engineer, Limor "Ladyada" Fried. Her goal was to create the best place online for learning electronics and making the best-designed products for makers of all ages and skill levels. Limor is a proud contributor to the open-source community, offering all of her product designs for free on Adafruit’s website, and participated in the first Open Source Hardware Summit drafting of the Open Source Hardware definition. Limor was the first female engineer on the cover of WIRED magazine, was awarded Entrepreneur magazine's Entrepreneur of the Year, was awarded the Most Influential Women in Technology award byFast Company magazine, was on the cover of Make: Vol. 57, and was named a WHITEHOUSE CHAMPION OF CHANGE in 2016.​Follow ourLinkedInpage as we announce the 2 remaining speakers!​​​​AGENDA​​​​​6:30 - Arrival, mingle, grab refreshments​​​​​7:00 - Welcome and introduction​​​7:15- Guest speakers with audience Q+A​​​8:20 - Community open mic​​​​​Anyone will have the chance or talk about what they are working on.​​​8:30 - Mix + mingle​​​WANT TO GET INVOLVED?​​​​Sponsorship:​We offer exclusive access to our 10,000+ member community through sponsorships.​​​​Host an event at your space:We are always looking for host sponsors to provide access to unique spaces from cool hardware companies building interesting things. Want to open up your office?​​​​Speaker:Do you have something interesting to share with our community? We're on the lookout for fresh faces to talk about their journey and experiences.​​​​If you want to get involved, head here:https://linktr.ee/nyhardware

events.name: 109th NY Hardware Meetup @ Ultimaker
events.description: ​About the Event​We’re back for the109th NY Hardware Meetup, hosted this month atUltimaker’sNYC officein the Financial District.​This is a chance to connect with other people building physical products in New York — from early-stage prototypes to shipped hardware.No fluff. Just speakers, demos, conversations, and good people.​We’ll havefree pizza and beer, live Ultimaker 3D printing in action, and updates on upcoming speakers and projects as we get closer.​RSVPs are limited.This event tends to fill up fast.​Follow us onLinkedInfor speaker announcements and event updates.​What to Expect​Open floor to connect with hardware founders, engineers, and designers​A behind-the-scenes look at how Ultimaker works​Live printing of your .STL files​Free food, drinks, and casual hangout time​Optional open mic to share what you’re working on​Legal Notice:By attending this event and participating in a visit to one or more UltiMaker facilities (collectively, the “Visit”), you acknowledge and agree to the following:​1.Confidentiality Obligations. During the Visit, you may receive or have access to certain confidential or proprietary information relating to UltiMaker and its business operations (“Confidential Information”). This includes, but is not limited to, information disclosed in verbal, visual, written, or other tangible forms, whether or not marked as “confidential.” You agree that you will not: (i) Disclose any Confidential Information to third parties, except as required by law and with prior written notice to UltiMaker; (ii) Use any Confidential Information for purposes other than those directly related to the Visit; (iii) Share Confidential Information within your own organization without prior written authorization from UltiMaker; (iv) Remove any documents, equipment, or items from the facilities without permission; or (v) Make any recordings (audio, video, or digital) or reproduce Confidential Information in any form. These confidentiality obligations apply for as long as the information remains a trade secret under applicable law, and for a period of three (3) years following the date of disclosure for all other Confidential Information.​2.Safety Requirements. All visitors are required to comply with safety rules and guidelines provided by UltiMaker representatives and/or posted in the facilities. You agree to exercise reasonable caution and follow all applicable safety instructions during the Visit.​Failure to adhere to these terms may result in removal from the premises and/or other appropriate actions.​By participating in this event, you indicate your understanding of and agreement to these conditions.​​​WANT TO GET INVOLVED?​​​​​SponsorshipWe're building a low-friction way to support the local hardware ecosystem. Sponsors help us cover food and venue costs in exchange for exposure to our 10,000+ member network and direct connection to early-stage builders and engineers.​Host an Event at Your SpaceWe’re always looking for companies willing to open their doors and show the community where real products are being built.​SpeakerHave a prototype, story, or hard-earned lesson to share? We’re looking for speakers who arein it— building something new, and willing to talk candidly about the process.​Want in? Reach out:https://linktr.ee/nyhardware

events.name: NYC Intern Summer Kickoff
events.description: ​🏙️NYC Intern Summer Kickoff​The Summer Kickoff You've Been Waiting For​Special Announcement:We are bringing the most exclusive intern experience to NYC this summer.​After seeing too many brilliant interns settle for generic corporate mixers, we decided to create something different. Something that matches the energy of the city that never sleeps and the ambition of the next generation building it.​NYC Intern Summer Kickoffis the premier summer kickoff event for elite interns who think bigger, move faster, and refuse to blend in.​🚀What Makes This Different​This isn't your typical networking event. This is where:​Top Gen Z founders who built million-dollar companies before 25share the playbook​Creator-entrepreneurs crushing it on multiple platformsreveal their strategies​NYC's most ambitious internsconnect with their future co-founders​Real talk, real connections, real opportunitieshappen​🎯The Experience​6:30 PM - 7:00 PM:Welcome ReceptionPremium networking with curated intro connections + CPG brand snacks​7:00 PM - 8:00 PM:Founder-Creator Panel"From Intern to Icon: Building Your Empire Before 25"​Featuring Gen Z founders who:​Turned internships into acquisition offers​Built personal brands with 100K+ engaged followers​Launched companies that VCs actually funded​Created multiple revenue streams before graduation​8:00 PM - 8:30 PM:Empire MixerFinal networking with fellow interns, founders, and industry operators​💎Who Should Attend​✅Summer interns(Tech, Finance, Consulting, Media)✅Aspiring founderswith side projects already in motion✅Content creatorsbuilding their personal brand✅Students/recent gradsinterning in NYC metro area✅Anyone who sees their internship as a stepping stone, not the destination​🏆Featured Panelists​Curating NYC's most impressive Gen Z founder-creators who built empires while their peers were still figuring out their majors.​Panel lineup dropping soon...​🤝Event Partners & Co-Hosts​​The Collective NY: Exclusive community for top young talent, building opportunities for NYC's most ambitious young leaders​​Jonas - Cofounder of The Collective.Connect with him here.​​Maggie - Cofounder of The Collective.Connect with her here.​This event is brought to you by a collective of ambitious operators and founders who believe in elevating the next generation.​Each co-host brings their unique expertise and network to create an unmatched experience for attendees.​📍Venue​Premium Manhattan location(Exact address sent with confirmation)Time:6:30 PM - 8:30 PM ESTDress Code:Come as you are​🎟️Registration​100% FREE- Because we believe in investing in the next generation​Full panel + mixer access​Premium snacks from emerging CPG brands​Limited to 150 attendees - first come, first served​We will personally review and accept the most impressive applications.​💭Why We Are Hosting This​As a group who's built multiple companies and invested in dozens of startups, we see the same pattern: the interns who win big are the ones who think like founders from day one.​They don't just complete assignments—they identify opportunities.They don't just network—they build genuine relationships.They don't just consume content—they create value.​This event is for the 1% of interns who already think this way, and the 10% who are ready to level up.​We covering all costs because we believe the next generation of founders deserves the same opportunities we had—regardless of their bank account.​Your internship is just the beginning. Your empire starts here.​📧Partnership & Sponsorship Inquiries​Interested in partnering with us or sponsoring this exclusive event?Contact:natalie@thegenztea.com​Questions? DM me directly.​Ready to claim your spot in NYC's most exclusive intern experience?

events.name: Gen Z NYC Founder & Creator Mixer
events.description: ​As we embrace spring in 2025, take a moment to celebrate your entrepreneurial journey with us in East Village! Join fellow ONE-OF-A-KIND Gen Z founders for an intimate evening of connection, inspiration, and well-deserved self-care at our April mixer.​So what the heck is GenZtea?GenZtea's Mission: Empowering Gen Z founders, creators, and investors to unlock their full potential through personal branding, community support, and innovative resources. We're building a global network of young builders who are not just invited into the room but are leading it.​Want to stay in the loop? Join our brand new newsletter athttps://genztea.beehiiv.com/subscribefor monthly deep dives with Gen Z lens, event updates, and community highlights! Reach is the new resume.​DM me if you are interested in getting featured in newsletter​✨ Brand New​✨: Gen Z Marketplace​DM me on Luma to have your food brand represented IRL at this event!​​🎁 Event Highlights:​​• Network with fellow Gen Z entrepreneurs & creators​​• Share experiences and insights​​• Discover potential collaborations​​• Enjoy refreshments​Want to sponsor? Reach out here on Luma or email natalie@thegenztea.com​​** Please note, this event will be photographed and filmed. GenZtea reserves the rights to use photographs and video from the event for marketing and communication purposes. By attending this event you consent to your image being used for these purposes and being added to GenZtea newsletter. **

events.name: NYC Tech Week Prayer Walk
events.description: ​NYC Tech Week Prayer Walk​A Event by GenZtea​Join us for a moment of mindfulness before the hustle of NYC Tech Week​Start your NYC Tech Week experience with intention and community. Join fellow tech professionals, entrepreneurs, and innovators for a guided prayer walk along Manhattan's iconic High Line park.​Event Details​Date:Saturday, June 1st, 2025Time:3:00 PM ESTMeeting Point:Shake Shack at Hudson YardsEnd Point:Chelsea Market​What to Expect​Our journey will begin with a group prayer at Hudson Yards, followed by a reflective walk along the elevated High Line park. As we stroll through this urban oasis, we'll have the opportunity to connect, share intentions for the week ahead, and enjoy breathtaking views of the city.​We'll conclude our walk at Chelsea Market with a final prayer of gratitude and intention-setting for NYC Tech Week.​Who This Is For​This event focuses on Christian founders and investors in the tech community, creating space for faith-centered networking and reflection. However, we warmly welcome participants of all backgrounds and beliefs who are interested in starting NYC Tech Week with intentionality and community.​Why Join?​Center yourself before the busy conference schedule​Network with like-minded professionals in a relaxed setting​Experience a unique perspective of NYC​Set meaningful intentions for your Tech Week experience​What to Bring​Comfortable walking shoes​Water bottle​Open mind and heart​This event is open to all, regardless of faith background or tradition. Our focus is on community, mindfulness, and setting positive intentions for the week ahead.​Register now to reserve your spot!​-----------------------------------------------------------------​About the Organizer​GenZteais a community of Gen Z founders, creators,and investors that brings Gen Z not just in the room, but at the table.​Community Supporters​Christians in Techwas founded by Andy Choi to create community and support for Christians working in the technology sector. The organization focuses on integrating faith with professional life in the tech industry.​TechWalkwas created by Christine Farrier Rosemin as a platform for meaningful connection in the tech community through guided walks that combine networking with mindfulness and movement.

events.name: AI Agents Hackathon
events.description: ​🤖 AI AGENT HACKATHON​Building the Future of Autonomous Intelligence​September 6, 2025|Co-hosted with The Residency​The Inflection Point is Now​2025 is the year of AI agents. While everyone else is still building wrappers around LLMs, the sharpest builders are crafting the autonomous systems that will define the next decade. Women make up just 22% of AI professionals worldwide and only 12% of AI researchers – but that changes here, today, with us.​This isn't another hackathon. This is where the future gets built.​What We're Building​Real agents. Real autonomy. Real impact.​We're talking multi-agent systems that reason, plan, and execute without handholding. Supply chain orchestrators. Research companions that think alongside you. Personal AI that actually understands context. The kind of technology that recent winners like RiskWise have proven can tackle complex domains like supply chain risk analysis with AI agents that provide timely, game-changing insights.​Prize Categories:​Who Should Be Here​The Builders:​Engineers who think in systems, not just code​Researchers who want their work in production, not just papers​Founders building the next Anthropic, not the next ChatGPT wrapper​Women in AIwho are tired of being the only one in the room​The Visionaries:​Product leaders who understand that agents ≠ chatbots​Technical founders ready to 10x human capability​Anyone who believes diverse teams are better at identifying potential biases and blind spots in AI systems​Why This Matters for Women​Women's involvement in AI isn't just about technical expertise – it's crucial for ensuring AI solutions tackle ethical and social challenges. Diversity brings unique insights into the ethical and societal implications of AI, helping reduce bias and create technologies that better serve all members of society.​We're actively building the future we want to see:​50% of judging panel are women leaders in AI​Dedicated mentorship track with female AI executives​Networking designed for meaningful connections, not small talk​Direct pipeline to female-founded AI companies actively hiring​Co-hosted with The Residency​The Residency – where ambitious builders live and work alongside equally driven peers – brings their network of entrepreneurs who've already raised from a16z, Collaborative Fund, and other top-tier investors. With Sam Altman as startup advisor and a track record of supporting high-potential builders, this isn't just an event – it's your entry point into the ecosystem that shapes the future.​The Technical Stack​What you'll have access to:​$1000 in credits per team across OpenAI, Anthropic, Groq, and Azure​Open source frameworks: LangGraph, AutoGen, CrewAI, Semantic Kernel​Real datasets from partners (healthcare, finance, climate, supply chain)​GPU clusters for training custom models​Direct API access to latest frontier models​What we expect:​Working demos, not slide decks​Code that runs, not promises it will​Impact that scales, not toys that impress​The Details​When:September 6, 2025 (24 hours of pure building)Where:Location TBDTeam Size:1-4 peopleSkill Level:Intermediate to Expert (we'll have tech talks, but this isn't a tutorial)​What's Included:​Meals designed by actual humans who understand nutrition​Late-night debugging sessions with people who actually get it​Post-event investor connections for top teams​Apply Now​Space is intentionally limited to 200 builders. We're optimizing for signal, not noise.​Commitment required:Full 24 hours, no exceptions​Special consideration for:​Women in AI (we're serious about changing the demographics)​Technical teams with novel approaches to agent architecture​Builders who've shipped AI products in production​International participants​"The future belongs to those who build it. And the future of AI belongs to those building autonomous agents today."​Ready to shape the next decade of AI?​Questions? Reach out to natalie@thegenztea.com​This event is committed to fostering an inclusive environment. All genders, backgrounds, and experience levels are welcome. We enforce a zero-tolerance policy for harassment.

events.name: DeSciNYC: Genome Editing in Early Human Embryos
events.description: ​Genome editing tools allow the introduction of precise changes in the DNA. For this ability, they became indispensable for basic biological research and hold great promise for future therapeutic applications. The same technologies are being utilized also in early human embryos for better understanding of key developmental regulators and DNA repair mechanisms. In the future, precise correction of specific genes might enable curing devastating diseases early in the development or decreasing the risks of certain diseases. Although continuous research is needed before such an intervention becomes safe, the first gene-edited babies were already born. This talk aims to contribute to the debate about human germline gene editing by putting it into a broader context of human biology, discussing the benefits, current limitations, and possible future alternatives leading to the prevention of genetic diseases.Stepan Jerabek is a postdoctoral research scientist in the Pediatrics Department at Columbia University. He is also an associate scientist at IOCB Prague, an institute of the Czech Academy of Sciences. Stepan’s interest in early development and genome stability brought him to the Egli laboratory, where he uses genome editing tools to study DNA repair in human preimplantation embryos. In 2024, Stepan was the recipient of the Druckenmiller Fellowship Award from the New York Stem Cell Foundation Research Institute. Stepan completed his doctoral training at the Max Planck Institute for Molecular Biomedicine in Germany and was a research fellow at Harvard Medical School, working in the lab of genetics pioneer George Church.🐦Stay Connected about Future Events:Twitter:@descinyc_Instagram:@descinyc​PS: Apply to be a member of the DeSci NYC group chat:https://forms.gle/AmUtotmCgWgGxWDp6
